Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.2: BIN GRID ID: Primary unique identifier for Bin grid.
Column Comment.3: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.4: BIN POINT ID: Unique identifier for the Bin Point.
Column Comment.5: BIN POINT VERSION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique value to identify diferentversions of the point location.
Column Comment.6: ACQUISITION IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for the coordinate acquisition.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: EASTING: The X coordinate for the node with respect to the point of origin of thespecified map projection.
Column Comment.9: EASTING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Easting value.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the well node version became effective.
Column Comment.11: ELEVATION: The elevation of the point
Column Comment.13: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.14: EAST WEST DISTANCE: Value of the East/West offset from the starting line to thelocation.
Column Comment.15: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.17: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.18: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.19: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.20: NORTHING: The Y coordinate for the node location with respect to the point of originof the specified map projection.
Column Comment.21: NORTHING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Northing value.
Column Comment.22: NORTH TYPE: The North reference used in surveying to define angularmeasurements. For example, True North, Magnetic North, Grid North, AstronomicalNorth, ...
Column Comment.23: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.24: NORTH SOUTH DISTANCE: Distance north or south from the start line to thelocation.
Column Comment.25: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline), ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.26: POLAR AZIMUTH: Value for the azimuth direction of polar offset, measured inangular degrees with a clockwise offset from true (geographic) north.
Column Comment.27: POLAR OFFSET: The map distance from the surface location to a point above thebottom hole location
Column Comment.28: POLAR OFFSET OUOM: Polar offset original unit of measure.
Column Comment.29: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.30: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this version of the point locationis preferred for general use, although other versions of the location may be requiredfor various specialized functions.
Column Comment.31: REFERENCE LOCATION: Description of the starting point for metes and boundsmeasurements. Typically the legal description of the corner. e.g. SE12-80-05-W5M,which represents the SE corner of section 12, township 80, range 5, West of the 5thMeridian in the DLS system. Similar constructs can be developed for the other legalsurvey systems. May also be used to refer to monument or other position used asreference point. Considered an unconstrained reference to MONUMENT.
Column Comment.32: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.33: SEISMIC POINT LABEL: the label or name commonly assigned to the point
Column Comment.34: POINT_LATITUDE: The latitude of the seismic point
Column Comment.35: POINT LONGITUDE: The longitude of the seismic point
Column Comment.36: SEISMIC POINT NUMBER: the numeric value of the seismic point number assignedto a seismic point. Used by processors.
Column Comment.37: UWI: The well that is used as a reference point for this location version.
Column Comment.38: VERSION TYPE: the type of well node version, such as actual, theoretical, orginal,agreed, rational etc.
Column Comment.39: X COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a mapping co-ordinate
Column Comment.40: Y COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a Y co-ordinate for mapping
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
